title: Dashboard
description: Your application's most important stats in one place

messages.createNewDashboardDescription: Create a new dashboard to visualize your data with custom widgets
messages.giveYourDashboardDescriptiveName: Give your dashboard a descriptive name
messages.helpOthersUnderstandPurpose: Help others understand the purpose of this dashboard
messages.pressEnterToAddTags: Press Enter to add tags. Tags help organize and find your dashboards.
messages.createAndManageAnalyticsDashboards: Create and manage your analytics dashboards
messages.noDashboardsMatch: No dashboards match "{query}". Try a different search term.
messages.getStartedByCreating: Get started by creating your first dashboard to visualize your data.
messages.areYouSureDeleteDashboard: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone. All widgets and data associated with this dashboard will be permanently removed.
messages.dragAndDropWidgets: Drag and drop widgets to customize your dashboard layout
messages.chooseWidgetType: Choose a widget type to add to your dashboard. You can configure it after adding.
messages.areYouSureDeleteWidget: Are you sure you want to delete this widget?
messages.youHaveUnsavedChanges: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to cancel?
messages.dashboardIsEmpty: This dashboard is empty. Add widgets to start visualizing your data.
messages.descriptiveTitle: A descriptive title for your widget
messages.showingAllDashboards: Showing all dashboards you have access to
messages.showingSharedDashboards: Showing public dashboards shared with you
messages.addWidgetInstructions: Use the "Add Widget" button in the top-right corner to get started.
messages.widgetPositionAdjusted: Widget position was adjusted to avoid overlap
messages.widgetPositionAdjustedDescription: Your widget has been placed in the next available position.
messages.shareDashboardWithRoles: Share this dashboard with specific roles and set their permission levels.

error.networkErrorDescription: A network error occurred. Please check your internet connection.
error.renderErrorDescription: A rendering error occurred with the widget. This might be due to invalid data or configuration.
error.genericErrorDescription: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again or contact support if the issue persists.
error.maxRetriesDescription: The widget could not be loaded after multiple attempts. Please check the configuration or contact support.

seriesTypes.stackedDescription: Stack series on top of each other
seriesTypes.overlaidDescription: Overlay series on the same axis

errors.nameMustBeDifferent: Name must be different from the current name

errors.dashboardNotFoundDescription: This dashboard may have been deleted or you may not have permission to view it.

metrics.totalActiveUsersDescription: Total users with a recently active session
metrics.loginConversion: Of verified users who logged in

templates.description: Pre-configured widgets you can add with one click

wizard.templateHint: Or skip the wizard and use a pre-configured template

metric.chooseWhatToMeasure: Choose what you want to measure from your data

count.label: Count records

wizard.createWidgetDescription: Create a new widget to visualize your data
wizard.editWidgetDescription: Edit an existing widget to visualize your data

basicInfo.title: Widget Information
basicInfo.subtitle: Provide basic details about your widget
basicInfo.nameHelper: A descriptive name for your widget
basicInfo.descriptionHelper: Optional description of what this widget displays

placeholders.widgetDescription: Brief description of what this widget shows...

basicInfoAndType.title: Widget Configuration
basicInfoAndType.subtitle: Set up your widget name and select the visualization type

widgetType.title: Widget Type
widgetType.subtitle: Select the type of visualization for your data

chart.name: Chart Widget
chart.description: Show trends and comparisons with bar charts, line graphs, or area charts - like sales over time

metric.name: Metric Widget
metric.description: Display a big number like "Total: 1,247" or "Average: $85.50" - perfect for KPIs and key statistics

table.name: Table Widget
table.description: Show your data in rows and columns - like a list of customers, orders, or any detailed records

dataConfig.title: Data Source
dataConfig.subtitle: Select the data source and configure widget settings

preview.title: Preview & Create
preview.subtitle: Review your widget configuration and see how it will look
preview.readyToCreateHelp: Click "Create Widget" to add this widget to your dashboard
preview.completeConfiguration: Complete the configuration to see a preview

filters.title: Data Filters
filters.subtitle: Apply filters to limit the data shown in your widget (optional)
filters.helpText: Add filters to narrow down your data. You can combine multiple filters using AND/OR logic.
filters.filtersAppliedCount: {count} filter{count, plural, one {} other {s}} applied to your data
filters.noFiltersOptional: This is optional. Click "Next" to continue or add filters above.
filters.configureDataSourceHelp: Go back to the previous step to select your data source before setting up filters.

tip.title: üí° Performance Tip
tip.timeConstraint: Add a time filter (like "last 30 days") to improve query performance and get more focused, actionable data. Large historical datasets can be slow and overwhelming.

requirement.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Date Filter Required
requirement.dateFilterRequired: Trend comparison is enabled for this widget. You must add a date filter to define the time period for trend analysis.

advanced.noConfig: No advanced configuration available for this widget type.

chart.configureToDisplay: Configure the widget to display data

config.title: Chart Data Configuration
config.subtitle: Configure how your data will be visualized in the chart

formatting.title: Number Formatting
formatting.description: Choose how numbers should be displayed on your chart
formatting.yAxisDescription: Format the values displayed on the left side of your chart

config.xAxisDescription: The column to display on the X-axis of the chart
config.yAxisDescription: The column to display on the Y-axis of the chart
config.aggregationMethodDescription: The method to aggregate the data
config.groupingOptionalDescription: The column to group the data by
config.timeAggregationDescription: How to group time-based data for visualization
config.multiSeriesDescription: Display multiple data series on the same chart
config.seriesTypeDescription: How multiple series should be displayed
config.seriesGroupColumnsDescription: Select columns to create separate series
config.maxSeriesDescription: Maximum number of series to display (1-20)

warnings.noNumericColumns: This table has no numeric columns. You can still create charts using 'Record Count' as the Y-axis to count records per category or time period.

config.whatStoryTitle: What story do you want to tell?
config.whatStorySubtitle: Choose the best way to visualize your data story
config.selectVisualization: Select how you want to show your data
config.whatDataTitle: What data do you want to show?
config.whatDataSubtitle: Choose categories to compare and values to measure

bar.label: Compare values (Bar chart)
bar.examples: e.g., Sales by region, products by rating, users by plan

line.label: Show trends over time (Line chart)
line.description: Perfect for tracking changes and patterns
line.examples: e.g., Revenue growth, user signups over months, website traffic

area.label: Show cumulative totals (Area chart)
area.description: Great for showing accumulation or composition
area.examples: e.g., Total revenue over time, stacked user types, budget vs spending

config.whatToCompare: What do you want to compare?
config.requiresDateColumn: This chart type requires a date/time column
config.shownAtBottom: This will be shown along the bottom of your chart
config.whatToMeasure: What do you want to measure?
config.chooseWhatToCount: Choose what to count or calculate
config.howManyItems: How many items in each category?
config.shownOnLeft: This will be shown on the left side of your chart
config.howToCalculateTitle: How should we calculate the chart values?
config.howToCalculateSubtitle: Since you selected "{{yAxis}}", how should we turn that into chart numbers?

count.label: Count how many
count.description: Count the number of records in each category

sum.label: Add them up
sum.description: Add up all the values to get a total

avg.label: Find the average
avg.description: Calculate the average value across records

min.label: Find the smallest
min.description: Show the minimum value in each group

max.label: Find the largest
max.description: Show the maximum value in each group

config.calculationHint: This determines how your data gets turned into chart values
config.countOnlyForAllRecords: Only "Count" works when measuring all records. Select a specific column above for more options.
config.chooseSplit: Choose how to split your data
config.separateBarsByCategory: Show separate bars for each category
config.splitHint: Split your data to see breakdowns by different categories
config.advancedComparisonsHint: Compare multiple data series side-by-side or stacked
config.sideBySideHint: Show bars next to each other for easy comparison
config.stackedHint: Stack bars on top of each other to show totals

preview.barCount: Bar chart showing how many records exist for each {{xLabel}}
preview.lineCount: Line chart tracking record count over time by {{xLabel}}
preview.areaCount: Area chart displaying cumulative record count by {{xLabel}}
preview.areaStyle: Filled area under the trend line

metric.configureToDisplay: Configure the widget to display data

config.title: Metric Data Configuration
config.subtitle: Configure the metric calculation and trend analysis

formatting.title: Number Display
formatting.question: How should this number be displayed?
formatting.description: Choose how to format the number for better readability

config.explanation: Metric widgets display a single number (KPI) calculated from your data - like totals, averages, or counts.
config.examplesTitle: Examples: "Total Users: 1,247" ‚Ä¢ "Average Order Value: $85.50" ‚Ä¢ "New Sign-ups This Month: 342"
config.selectMetricColumn: Select column to calculate metric from
config.groupingHint: Break down your metric by categories or time periods to see distribution patterns
config.trendAnalysisHint: Compare current values with past periods to show growth or decline
config.trendDateColumnHint: Select which date/timestamp field to use for calculating trends over time
config.noDateColumns: No date columns found in this table
config.noDateColumnsWarning: This table has no date/timestamp columns. Trend analysis requires a date field to compare time periods.
config.trendComparisonHint: Compare current period with previous period to show trends
config.trendComparisonDescription: Add date filters below to enable automatic trend calculations
config.trendRequiresDateFilter: Date filter will be required in the next step
config.trendInstructions: In the next step, add a date filter to enable trend comparison. The system will automatically calculate periods based on your filter.
config.trendDirectionDescription: Choose whether higher or lower values indicate better performance
config.dateFilterRequiredDescription: Add a date filter to define the time period for trend comparison calculations
config.noDateColumnsAvailable: No date columns are available in this table for filtering
config.trendColumnSelected: This column will be used for trend analysis calculations

validation.columnRequired: Column is required for aggregations other than count
validation.dateFilterRequired: Date filter is required when trend comparison is enabled

config.metricSourceHint: Choose what to measure. Start with "All Records" for simple counts.
config.countOnlyForAllRecords: Only count is available when using "All Records"
config.howToCalculateNumeric: How to calculate this numeric value
config.onlyCountForText: Only count is available for text fields

warnings.orderingField: Ordering field detected: Summing position values (1+2+3...) rarely provides meaningful insights. Consider using "Count" instead to see how many records exist.
warnings.idField: ID field detected: Mathematical operations on IDs are not meaningful. Use "Count" to see how many records exist.

config.title: Table Data Configuration
config.subtitle: Configure which columns to display and table behavior
config.selectSpecificColumns: Click on columns below to show only specific ones
